section.title: Overview
section.para: This module implements a JSON server that handles GET requests and generates JSON responses.

section.title: &osips; Modules
section.para:
The following modules must be loaded before this module:
httpd module.

section.title: mi_json_root(string)
section.para: Specifies the root path for JSON requests: http://[opensips_IP]:[opensips_httpd_port]/[mi_json_root]

section.title: trace_destination (string)
section.para: Trace destination as defined in the tracing module. Currently the only tracing module is proto_hep. This is where traced mi messages will go.
WARNING: A tracing module must be loaded in order for this parameter to work. (for example proto_hep).

section.title: trace_bwlist (string)
section.para: Filter traced mi commands based on a blacklist or a whitelist. trace_destination must be defined for this parameter to have any purpose. Whitelists can be defined using 'w' or 'W', blacklists using 'b' or 'B'. The type is separate by the actual blacklist by ':'. The mi commands in the list must be separated by ','.

Defining a blacklists means all the commands that are not blacklisted will be traced. Defining a whitelist means all the commands that are not whitelisted will not be traced. WARNING: One can't define both a whitelist and a blacklist. Only one of them is allowed. Defining the parameter a second time will just overwrite the first one.
WARNING: A tracing module must be loaded in order for this parameter to work. (for example proto_hep).

example.title: Set trace_destination parameter
example.programlisting: ... ## blacklist ps and which mi commands ## all the other commands shall be traced modparam("mi_json", "trace_bwlist", "b: ps, which") ... ## allow only sip_trace mi command ## all the other commands will not be traced modparam("mi_json", "trace_bwlist", "w: sip_trace") ...

section.title: Exported Functions
section.para: No function exported to be used from configuration file.

section.title: Known issues
section.para: Commands with large responses (like ul_dump) will fail if the configured size of the httpd buffer is to small (or if there isn't enough pkg memory configured).
Future realeases of the httpd and mi_json modules will address this issue.

section.title: Examples
section.para: This is an example showing the JSON format for the get_statistics net: uri: MI command. Notice how the paramaters are comma-separated then URI-encoded.

example.title: JSON request
example.programlisting:
GET /json/get_statistics?params=net%3A%2Curi%3A HTTP/1.1 Accept: application/json Host: example.net
HTTP/1.1 200 OK Content-Length: 49 Content-Type: application/json Date: Fri, 01 Nov 2013 12:00:00 GMT
["net:waiting_udp = 0", "net:waiting_tcp = 0", "uri:positive checks = 0", "uri:negative_checks = 0"]

section.para: Here is another example showing the JSON format for the ps MI command.

example.title: JSON request
example.programlisting:
GET /json/ps HTTP/1.1 Accept: application/json Host: example.net
HTTP/1.1 200 OK Content-Length: 428 Content-Type: application/json Date: Fri, 01 Nov 2013 12:00:00 GMT
[{"name":"Process", "value":null, "attributes":{"ID": "0", "PID": "7400", "Type": "stand-alone SIP receiver udp:127.0.0.1:5060"}}, {"name":"Process", "value":null, "attributes":{"ID": "1", "PID": "7402", "Type": "HTTPD INADDR_ANY:8888"}}, {"name":"Process", "value":null, "attributes":{"ID": "2", "PID": "7403", "Type": "time_keeper"}}, {"name":"Process", "value":null, "attributes":{"ID": "3", "PID": "7404", "Type": "timer"}}]
